subject: Re: [junit] How can I set tests dynamical?
msgSnippet: There are many ways to accomplish this.  You can use JUnitAddons DirectorySuiteBuilder, you can use Ant, etc.  Try googling for Œjunit build suites¹ or
messageBody:
There are many ways to accomplish this. You can use JUnitAddons
DirectorySuiteBuilder, you can use Ant, etc. Try googling for junit build
suites¹ or something like that.

Jason

On 9/12/06 6:46 AM, "isowitz" <isowitz@...> wrote:

>
>
>
>
> For example. I have 20 several tests in my package. All tests can I
> start with a new class where I add a suite methode in with I add all
> tests I want.
>
> But if I have many packages I have to adjust all "AllTest"s. Is there
> an other way to define tests that should run eg. after a nightly build?
>
>
>
